00045 
00046   std::vector<GCoord> AtomicGroup::momentsOfInertia(void) const {
00047     Math::Matrix<double, Math::ColMajor> I(3, 3);  // This gets initialized to zero...
00048     GCoord c = centerOfMass();
00049 
00050     for (uint i = 0; i < atoms.size(); ++i) {
00051 
00052       GCoord u = atoms[i]->coords() - c;
00053       double m = atoms[i]->mass();
00054       I(0,0) += m * (u.y() * u.y() + u.z() * u.z());
00055       I(1,0) += m * u.x() * u.y();
00056       I(2,0) += m * u.x() * u.z();
00057       I(1,1) += m * (u.x() * u.x() + u.z() * u.z());
00058       I(2,1) += m * u.y() * u.z();
00059       I(2,2) += m * (u.x() * u.x() + u.y() * u.y());
00060     }
00061 
00062     I(1,0) = I(0,1) = -I(1,0);
00063     I(2,0) = I(0,2) = -I(2,0);
00064     I(2,1) = I(1,2) = -I(2,1);
00065 
00066     
00067     // Now compute the eigen-decomp...
00068     char jobz = 'V', uplo = 'U';
00069     f77int nn;
00070     f77int lda = 3;
00071     double W[3], work[128];
00072     f77int lwork = 128;   // ???  Just a guess for sufficient storage
00073     f77int info;
00074     nn = 3;
00075 
00076     dsyev_(&jobz, &uplo, &nn, I.get(), &lda, W, work, &lwork, &info);
00077     if (info < 0)
00078       throw(std::runtime_error("dsyev_ reported an argument error..."));
00079 
00080     if (info > 0)
00081       throw(std::runtime_error("dsyev_ failed to converge..."));
00082 
00083     std::vector<GCoord> results(4);
00084 
00085     for (int i=0; i<3; i++)
00086       results[2-i] = GCoord( I(0,i), I(1,i), I(2,i) );
00087 
00088 
00089     // Now push the eigenvalues on as a GCoord...
00090     c[0] = W[2];
00091     c[1] = W[1];
00092     c[2] = W[0];
00093 
00094     c /= size();
00095 
00096     results[3] = c;
00097 
00098     return(results);
00099   }

00102   std::vector<GCoord> AtomicGroup::principalAxes(void) const {
00103     // Extract out the group's coordinates...
00104     int i;
00105     int n = size();
00106     double M[3] = {0.0, 0.0, 0.0};
00107     int k = 0;
00108 
00109     double *A = coordsAsArray();
00110     for (i=0; i<n; i++) {
00111       M[0] += A[k++];
00112       M[1] += A[k++];
00113       M[2] += A[k++];
00114     }
00115 
00116     M[0] /= n;
00117     M[1] /= n;
00118     M[2] /= n;
00119 
00120     // Subtract off the mean...
00121     for (i=k=0; i<n; i++) {
00122       A[k++] -= M[0];
00123       A[k++] -= M[1];
00124       A[k++] -= M[2];
00125     }
00126 
00127     // Multiply A*A'...
00128     double C[9];
00129 #if defined(__linux__)
00130     char ta = 'N';
00131     char tb = 'T';
00132     f77int three = 3;
00133     double zero = 0.0;
00134     double one = 1.0;
00135 
00136     dgemm_(&ta, &tb, &three, &three, &n, &one, A, &three, A, &three, &zero, C, &three);
00137     
00138 #else
00139     cblas_dgemm(CblasColMajor, CblasNoTrans, CblasTrans,
00140                 3, 3, n, 1.0, A, 3, A, 3, 0.0, C, 3);
00141 #endif
00142 
00143     delete[] A;
00144 
00145     // Now compute the eigen-decomp...
00146     char jobz = 'V', uplo = 'U';
00147     f77int nn;
00148     f77int lda = 3;
00149     double W[3], work[128];
00150     f77int lwork = 128;   // ???  Just a guess for sufficient storage to be
00151     // efficient... 
00152     f77int info;
00153     nn = 3;
00154 
00155     dsyev_(&jobz, &uplo, &nn, C, &lda, W, work, &lwork, &info);
00156     if (info < 0)
00157       throw(std::runtime_error("dsyev_ reported an argument error..."));
00158 
00159     if (info > 0)
00160       throw(std::runtime_error("dsyev_ failed to converge..."));
00161 
00162     std::vector<GCoord> results(4);
00163     GCoord c;
00164 
00165     k = 0;
00166     for (i=0; i<3; i++) {
00167       c[0] = C[k++];
00168       c[1] = C[k++];
00169       c[2] = C[k++];
00170       results[2-i] = c;
00171     }
00172 
00173     // Now push the eigenvalues on as a GCoord...
00174     c[0] = W[2];
00175     c[1] = W[1];
00176     c[2] = W[0];
00177     c /= size();   // Scale by # of atoms...
00178 
00179     results[3] = c;
00180 
00181     return(results);
00182   }

00187   GMatrix AtomicGroup::superposition(const AtomicGroup& grp) {
00188     int i, j;
00189     XForm W;
00190 
00191     int n = size();
00192     // Center both groups at the origin...
00193 
00194     GCoord xc = centroid();
00195     W.translate(-xc);
00196     double *X = transformedCoordsAsArray(W);
00197   
00198 
00199     GCoord yc = grp.centroid();
00200     W.identity();
00201     W.translate(-yc);
00202     double *Y = grp.transformedCoordsAsArray(W);
00203 
00204     // Compute correlation matrix...
00205     double R[9];
00206 #if defined(__linux__)
00207     char ta = 'N';
00208     char tb = 'T';
00209     f77int three = 3;
00210     double one = 1.0;
00211     double zero = 0.0;
00212     
00213     dgemm_(&ta, &tb, &three, &three, &n, &one, X, &three, Y, &three, &zero, R, &three);
00214 
00215 #else
00216 
00217     cblas_dgemm(CblasColMajor, CblasNoTrans, CblasTrans, 3, 3, n, 1.0, X, 3, Y, 3, 0.0, R, 3);
00218 
00219 #endif
00220 
00221     double det = R[0]*R[4]*R[8] + R[3]*R[7]*R[2] + R[6]*R[1]*R[5] -
00222       R[0]*R[7]*R[5] - R[3]*R[1]*R[8] - R[6]*R[4]*R[2];
00223 
00224     // Now compute the SVD of R...
00225     char jobu = 'A', jobvt = 'A';
00226     f77int m = 3, lda = 3, ldu = 3, ldvt = 3, lwork=100, info;
00227     double work[lwork];
00228     f77int nn = 3;
00229     double S[3], U[9], Vt[9];
00230   
00231     dgesvd_(&jobu, &jobvt, &m, &nn, R, &lda, S, U, &ldu, Vt, &ldvt, work, &lwork, &info);
00232 
00233     // Adjust U (if necessary)
00234     if (det < 0.0) {
00235       U[6] = -U[6];
00236       U[7] = -U[7];
00237       U[8] = -U[8];
00238     }
00239 
00240     // Compute the rotation matrix...
00241     double M[9];
00242 
00243 #if defined(__linux__)
00244 
00245     dgemm_(&ta, &ta, &three, &three, &three, &one, U, &three, Vt, &three, &zero, M, &three);
00246 
00247 #else
00248 
00249     cblas_dgemm(CblasColMajor, CblasNoTrans, CblasNoTrans, 3, 3, 3, 1.0, U, 3, Vt, 3, 0.0, M, 3);
00250 
00251 #endif
00252 
00253     // Construct the new transformation matrix...  (W = M')
00254     GMatrix Z;
00255     for (i=0; i<3; i++)
00256       for (j=0; j<3; j++)
00257         Z(i,j) = M[i*3+j];
00258 
00259     //W(0,3) = yc.x();
00260     //W(1,3) = yc.y();
00261     //W(2,3) = yc.z();
00262 
00263 
00264     W.identity();
00265     W.translate(yc);
00266     W.concat(Z);
00267     W.translate(-xc);
00268 
00269     delete[] X;
00270     delete[] Y;
00271 
00272 
00273     return(W.current());
00274   }
00275 
00276 
00277   GMatrix AtomicGroup::alignOnto(const AtomicGroup& grp) {
00278     XForm W;
00279     GMatrix M = superposition(grp);
00280 
00281     W.load(M);
00282     applyTransform(W);
00283 
00284     return(M);
00285   }
